title: Cousin Nodes Sum
description: Given a binary tree and a target node value, find the sum of the values of all nodes that are cousins of the target node.  Cousins are defined as nodes that are at the same level and have different parents.  If the target node is not found, return 0.

examples.explanation: Node 5's cousins are node 6 (same level, different parents).  The sum is 6.
Node 5's cousins are nodes 6 and 7 (same level, different parents). The sum is 6 + 7 = 13. Node 8 is not considered as it is on a different level.

Node 2 has no cousins.


Constraints:
- The tree will contain only positive integer values.
- The number of nodes in the tree will be at most 1000.
- The target node value will always be a value present in the tree (or 0 if no such node is present).
- Time complexity should be O(N), where N is the number of nodes in the tree.
- Space complexity should be O(N) in the worst case (due to potential recursion depth or queue size for BFS).
